channel.title: Click To Teleport
channel.description:
Hey,
I was watching a few J Mod videos and I noticed they can teleport to where they click. Is there a way I can do this for my server for admins?
EDIT: I've followed this guide [url=http://www.rune-server.org/runescape-development/google/snippets/517113-click-teleport.html]http://www.rune-server.org/runescape-development/google/snippets/517113-click-teleport.html[/url] but I get this error when I compile:
[code]src\server\model\players\packets\Commands.java:474: error: illegal start of expr ession public int cilckToTeleport = 0; ^ 1 error Press any key to continue . . .[/code]

item.title: Click To Teleport
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Mr.Draconian, post:14, topic:551000”]Is firststepx decleared in Player.java server sided? if it is try importing it in walking.java

import server.model.players.Player;[/quote]
If firstStepX is decalred in the Player class, he needs to add the client object before the variable so it’s like:

or similar.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Mr.Draconian Mr.Draconian
item.description:

import server.model.players.Player;

item.title: Click To Teleport
item.dc:creator: @mrpopyman mrpopyman
item.description:
@mrpopyman wrote:

[quote=“popcorn57, post:10, topic:551000”]I just tried and added to my server. I was stumped to. But notice how it is looking for the int: clicktoteleport <---- the guy did a typo and spelled it cilcktoteleport. So those private and public ints you added have typos lol. but I also added

public int clickToTeleport = 0;

to my client.java.

hope this helps![/quote]

I fixed up the spelling mistakes and it’s gone from 15 errors to 9.

These are the errors I’m currently still getting now:

[code]src\server\model\players\packets\Walking.java:71: error: cannot find symbol
firstStepX = c.getInStream().readSignedWordBigEndianA()-c.getMap
RegionX()*8;
^

firstStepX = c.getInStream().readSignedWordBigEndianA();

                    ^

location: class Walking

firstStepX = c.getInStream().readSignedWordBigEndianA()-
c.getMapRegionX()*8;
^
symbol: variable firstStepX
location: class Walking

firstStepY = c.getInStream().readSignedWordBigEndian();
^

location: class Walking
src\server\model\players\packets\Walking.java:119: error: cannot find symbol

.getMapRegionY()*8;
^
symbol: variable firstStepY
location: class Walking

c.getPA().movePlayer(c.getNewWalkCmdX()[i1] + fi
rstStepX, c.getNewWalkCmdY()[i1] + firstStepY, c.heightLevel);
^
symbol: variable firstStepX
location: class Walking
src\server\model\players\packets\Walking.java:123: error: cannot find symbol

rstStepX, c.getNewWalkCmdY()[i1] + firstStepY, c.heightLevel);

^

item.title: Click To Teleport
item.dc:creator: @ohokay ohokay
item.description:
@ohokay wrote:

The

public int clickToTeleport;

should be in the Player class

p.s there is a spelling error, it says “cilick” in the post, but it should be “click”

Read full topic

item.title: Click To Teleport
item.dc:creator: @runescape_sucks runescape sucks
item.description:
@runescape_sucks wrote:

Here’s a snippet on a way it can work. However, this is limited by where your clipped, so you can’t click through walls you couldn’t already walk through. Also note, this is all server-sided.

Edit: if it was partially client-sided, you could probably get it to clip through walls.

[code=java]
int currentX = player.getLocalX();
int currentY = player.getLocalY();
int lastX = player.getNewWalkCmdX()[player.newWalkCmdSteps-1];
int lastY = player.getNewWalkCmdY()[player.newWalkCmdSteps-1];

		int teleToX = player.absX + (lastX - currentX);
		int teleToY = player.absY + (lastY - currentY);
		
		//put teleport method here

		player.newWalkCmdSteps = 0;
		player.getNewWalkCmdX()[0] = player.getNewWalkCmdY()[0] = 0;[/code]

That would go in your walking packet handler, at the end of where the walking is handled. If you want to limit it to just minimap clicking, check if it’s packet ID is 248.

Read full topic

item.title: Click To Teleport
item.dc:creator: @popcorn57 popcorn57
item.description:
@popcorn57 wrote:

I just tried and added to my server. I was stumped to. But notice how it is looking for the int: clicktoteleport <---- the guy did a typo and spelled it cilcktoteleport. So those private and public ints you added have typos lol. but I also added

public int clickToTeleport = 0;

to my client.java.

hope this helps!

Read full topic

item.title: Click To Teleport
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

You put the int inside of another method or inside another variable.

Here’s an example of your error

public void someCoolMethod(int aValue) { public int clickToTeleport = 0; }

You can also look here for more information on it.

Read full topic
